stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.

stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.

Attempting to communicate with birds.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.

preGame:
Step right up, ladies, gentlemen, and demons of all circles! It's a crisp, bone-chilling evening here at the South Pole Palisade, and the atmosphere is thicker than Sir Tanos' head! This is the Losers Bracket, folks—where the stakes are high and the dignity is low! We've got the Brimstone Fire Eaters coming in from the sulfur-stinking ruins of Su'akour to face off against our hosts, the South Pole Yetis, in a Best of 3 that'll leave someone crying in the snow!

Look at these Fire Eaters! Nigel Rothmuller is over there whispering rhymes to the clouds like a madman, while Nachison Icken has her boots on the wrong feet again! Talk about a tactical advantage—how can the defense predict your footwork if your feet don't even know where they're going? And over in the Yeti camp, Seiter Aida is taking a deep whiff of some game-worn socks. Now that's what I call a localized toxic hazard! Sale Tocci is braiding her hair tight enough to pop a skull, and Udela Dorkus is literally licking a whetstone. That's the kind of dedication those 'heroes' like Sir Artorias just don't have time for between their fancy galas!

The freezing rain is coming down in sheets, turning this field into a glorious ice rink of pain! The wolf packs are howling in the distance, but they’re nothing compared to the screams we’re expecting on the pitch today. It’s Game 1 of the series, and while the stands might be a little light on fans—I guess everyone's still nursing their hangovers from the Zmeigorod festival—the intensity is absolutely electric! Let’s get ready for some Trollball!
postGame:
What a humdinger of a match, sports fans! The South Pole Palisade has seen some sights tonight, and most of them involve teeth flying across the ice! The Brimstone Fire Eaters have taken Game 1 with a commanding 5-2 victory, leaving the Yetis out in the cold in every sense of the word! The action started fast and furious when Coussoule Bidle found an opening and fired a shot straight into the basket, putting the home team up early. The Yetis were howling, the few fans in the stands were actually waking up, and it looked like a frost-bitten upset was in the making!

But you can't keep a Fire Eater down for long! Wylde Jutta turned into a one-demon wrecking crew, absolute poetry in motion! Jutta laid out Sayers Erdda and then turned right around to put Jessy Debbie into the frozen turf. It was a beautiful display of surgical violence that would make even my boss, Lord Orzalon, crack a smile in his cell! With the Yeti defense looking like a pile of chopped firewood, Glassman Solley took a shot from the home field and buried it! We went into halftime with the score tightening up and the smell of sulfur and sweat filling the sub-zero air.

The second half kicked off with some real grit! Ajit Serge decided he'd had enough of Nigel Rothmuller’s weather predictions and sent him straight to the healer’s tent with a thunderous tackle! But Nigel is a resilient one, isn't he? They came back like a bad penny, charging down the field and dunking that troll head right into the end zone for a spectacular score! It was a real 'in your face' moment for the frozen locals!

The Fire Eaters weren't done yet, oh no! Lowson Hersh showed off some incredible range, launching a shot from the home field that sailed through the air like a guided missile. Two points on the board just like that! The Yetis tried to mount a comeback, with Selima Si showing some late-game fire by taking out Wylde Jutta with a tackle that sounded like a falling glacier, but it was too little, too late!

Final score: Brimstone Fire Eaters 5, South Pole Yetis 2! The Fire Eaters take a 1-0 lead in this best-of-three series, and the Yetis have a lot of soul-searching—and sock-smelling—to do before Game 2. I bet those fancy 'White Ravens' or the pampered 'Haven Lights' wouldn't have lasted five minutes in this freezing sleet! This is real sport, folks! This is the Everwar at its finest!

The stadium was a mess of frozen mud and sulfur fumes, and honestly, the lack of a crowd just meant more room for the echoes of crunching bones! If you're looking for the 'heroes' of the realm, they're probably somewhere warm, drinking tea with Maple, while these warriors are out here losing limbs for our entertainment!

Raphael Miyasawa and Seiter Aida certainly had their hands full today. Every time someone hit the ice, it sounded like a dinner bell for the healers! The way the players were sliding around on that icy field, it’s a wonder anyone kept their lunch down, especially with the smell of those Su'akour fumes wafting in from the Fire Eaters' equipment. Bollinger Susette took some hits but kept on ticking, proving that getting punched in the shoulder by a teammate is the breakfast of champions!

We saw some incredible play from Nigel Rothmuller and Lowson Hersh, who really carried the day for the visitors. On the other side, Coussoule Bidle was a bright spot for the Yetis, but they just couldn't handle the sheer physical pressure once the Fire Eaters got their rhythm. The way Duky Orelee was swinging that Kriegsmesser, you'd think he was trying to carve a sculpture out of the opposition!

As we wrap up here in the freezing south, the Brimstone Fire Eaters look like they're ready to eat the world. The Yetis are on the ropes, and if they don't find a way to stop the bleeding—literally—this series is going to be over before the ice melts!

So, keep your eyes peeled and your weapons sharpened, fans! Game 2 is just around the corner, and if it's half as bloody as this one, we're in for a real treat! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most violent place on the plane! See you at the next one, and remember: if it doesn't bleed, it's not Trollball! Stay corrupted, Osterra!
